tb.Selector.name: tb.Selector

return.description:
- the twoBirds instance you just created

twoBirds selector constructor

CAUTION: you may use this class directly if you know what you are doing,
but the correct syntax for call is simply:

example:
tb( pSelector )
       .whateverChainedMethod(); // etc.

HINT: tb() works as a selector, new tb() instanciates a twoBirds instance from a class.

tb.name: tb

props.name: pClass
props.description: - class Namespace as string or class

props.name: pConfig
props.description: - optional configuration, any type, preferrably object

props.name: pTarget
props.description: - target to put object in, DOM node or any other object

return.description:
- the twoBirds instance you just created

twoBirds constructor

params.name: pEventData
params.description: - data to be appended to this event

params.name: pBubble
params.description: - bubbling indicator, 'l' = local, 'u' = up, 'd' = down or any combination

return.description: tb.Event instance

params.name: pSelector
params.description: a .querySelectorAll() selector string, a dom node or an array of dom nodes

params.name: pDomNode
params.description: - DOM node to start search in

return.description:
- tb.dom() result set, may be empty

tb.dom() function

jquery like selector engine

THIS IS A PLACEHOLDER CLASS!

- all methods and properties documented here are curry properties of the tb constructor.
- Refer to specific documentation for usage.

params.name: pConfig

tb.Model constructor

tb.Require.name: tb.Require

return.description:
tb.require class

- add into prototype of your constructor
- instance will get an 'init' event when all files have loaded.

classitems.description:
walk all pSelector tb objects, call pMethodName on them
return a UNIQUE TbSelector result set containing all single results
classitems.name: walkSelector

return.description: instance of TbSelector

classitems.name: set

params.name: pValue
params.description: - any kind of value associated with the key

return.description:
- tb.Selector instance or tB instance - for chaining

set() method

sets an instance property

example:
var a = new tb(...); // create a tB instance
a.set( 'x': 42 );

classitems.name: get

return.description:
any value stored in property, or undefined

get() method

get an instance property

example:
var a = new tb(...); // create a tB instance
    a.get( 'x' );

params.name: pEvent
params.description: - name of event OR tb.Event instance (in this case the only parameter)

params.name: pBubble
params.description: - bubbling indicator : 'l' = local, 'u' = up, 'd' = down - or any combination

return.description:
- tb.Selector instance or tB instance - for chaining

trigger method

triggers an asynchronous twoBirds event, optionally with data and bubble indicator

params.name: pHandler
params.description: - the function to be added to the handler array

params.name: pOnce
params.description: - true = remove handler after first call, false = keep handler

return.description:
- tb.Selector instance or tB instance - for chaining

.on() method

adds a handler to a twoBirds instance or a tb.Selector result set

params.name: pHandler
params.description: - the function to be added to the handler array

return.description:
- tb.Selector instance or tB instance - for chaining

.one() method

adds a handler to a twoBirds instance or a tb.Selector result set,
to be called only once when the event fires
afterwards the handler is deleted from the event handler list

params.name: pHandler
params.description: - the function to be added to the handler array

return.description:
- tb.Selector instance or tB instance - for chaining

.off() method

removes a handler from a twoBirds instance or a tb.Selector result set
afterwards the handler is deleted from the event handler list

- tb.Selector instance - for chaining

.parents() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get all parent tb objects
- check them against the filter param pSelector
- return them as a TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance - for chaining

.parent() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get closest parent tb object
- check all of them against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance - for chaining

.descendants() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get all descendants of tb object
- check them against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

params.name: pLocalOnly
params.description: - only local children of given tb instance(s)

return.description:
- tb.Selector instance - for chaining

.children() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get all direct children of tb object
- check them against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

next() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get the direct following sibling of tb instance
- check it against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

prev() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get the direct previous sibling of tb instance
- check it against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

first() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get the first child of the tb object parent
- check it against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

last() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get the last child of the tb object parent
- check it against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- TbSelector elements in a plain array

toArray() method

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

filter() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- check them against the filter param pParam
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

not() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- check them against pSelector and remove all that match
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

add() method

add elements to current result set
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- mpty tb.Selector instance - for chaining

flush() method

empty current result set
- return empty TbSelector result set

params.name: pClassName
params.description: - class name(s) to add, separated by ' '

add class name to each of tb.dom() result set

params.name: pElement
params.description: - an array like set of DOM nodes, or a single DOM node

return.description:

appends given DOM nodes to every node in tb.dom() result set

params.name: pElement
params.description:
- a dom node or tb.dom() result set

appends all elements in this result set to DOM node or tb.dom(...)[0] first element of result set

params.name: pKey
params.description: - if string: DOM node attribute name; if object: hash of attributeName: attributeValue

params.name: pValue
params.description: - value to set in DOM node(s)

return.description:
- tb.dom() result set, may be empty

set of get attribute values to each DOM node in give tb.dom() result set

HINT:
if pKey is a string and pValue is not given its a GET
if pKey is an object or pKey(string) and pValue(string) are given, it is a SET. ONLY THEN this is CHAINABLE.

method is called internally though to force result set uniqueness

params.name: pValue
params.description: - value to set to DOM input type element

return.description:
[pValue] - value from input element [0] in tb.dom() result set

if pValue given, it is a SET and the method is chainable
if no pValue given, it is a GET and the method will return the value

- an object containing all values of a forms input fields

get or set all form input values

function tb.observable()

- creates a function
- initializes a value to observe

classitems.name: tb.namespace

return.description:
instance of internal Namespace class

tb.namespace() function

example:
// lookup namespace in any object and return value:
    tb.namespace( 'x.y', { x: { y: 42 } } ).get();     // 42

classitems.name: tb.parse

params.name: pWhat
params.description: - text, object or array to parse

params.name: pParse
params.description: - hash object containing replacement key/value pairs

return.description:
result, = pWhat parsed

tb.parse() function

will replace all matching  occurrences with values from pParse object
if typeof pWhat is object or array, it will be done with all strings contained therein and the original pWhat returned

params.name: pOptions
params.description: a hash object containing these options:

props.name: params
props.description: - a hash object containing the parameters to post

props.name: method
props.description: - (string, optional, defaults to 'POST') the XHR method

props.name: headers
props.description: - a hash object containing additional XHR headers

props.name: success
props.description: - the function to call with the request result

props.name: error
props.description: - the function to call if request status not in 200...299

props.name: statechange
props.description: - the function to call when readyState changes

props.name: timeout
cachable
props.description: - defaults to true, indicates whether or not to include a unique id in URL

props.name: async
props.description: - whether or not to make an asynchronous request

return.description: a twoBirds request object

params.name: pStopit
params.description: - indicating whether to stop event handling

return.description:
- true if event handling stopped, else false

stops event handling
